In his written submissions, the Int: Judicial review has, I think developed to a stage today when without reiterating
any  analysis  of  the  steps  by  which  the  development  has  come  about,  one  can

In his written submissions, the Int: is  not  complaining  about  the  procedure

premises by: followed by the 1st Respondent. Her complaint instead is that the 1st Respondent has

identify illegality in the following manner:

In his written submissions, the Int: “By  ‘illegality’  as  a  ground  for  judicial  review  I  mean  that  the  decision-  maker

and must give effect to it. Whether he has or not is par excellence a justiciable
question to be decided in the event of dispute, by those persons, the judges, by

whom the judicial power of the state is exercisable.”
